intro: Craspedia canens, commonly known as the silverleaf craspedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has silver-gray foliage that helps it reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. Its growth habit is usually low and spreading, with small, narrow leaves. Craspedia canens is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand salty sea breezes.
